note: EPA registration numbers and specific percentages should be verified against current product labels. Quali-Pro specializes in post-patent/generic active ingredients for professional turf management. Always confirm rates and registrations with the most current label.

propiconazole.notes: Generic equivalent to Banner MAXX. Systemic DMI fungicide. Widely used in rotational programs.

chlorothalonil_720_sft.notes: Generic equivalent to Daconil Weather Stik. Multi-site contact fungicide with very low resistance risk. Excellent tank-mix partner.

chlorothalonil_df.notes: Dry flowable formulation of chlorothalonil. Generic equivalent to Daconil Ultrex.

azoxystrobin.notes: Generic equivalent to Heritage TL/SC. Broad-spectrum strobilurin. Rotate with non-Group 11 fungicides for resistance management.

thiophanate_methyl_4.5f.notes: Generic equivalent to Cleary 3336F. Systemic fungicide. High resistance risk -- rotate with multi-site or different MOA fungicides.

thiophanate_methyl_e_pro.notes: E-Pro enhanced formulation of thiophanate-methyl. Same active as T-Methyl 4.5F in improved delivery system.

thiophanate_methyl_wsp.notes: Water-soluble bag formulation. Generic equivalent to Cleary 3336 WP.

iprodione_2se.notes: Generic equivalent to Chipco 26019. Contact fungicide with local systemic activity. Best for dollar spot and brown patch.

mancozeb_flowable.notes: Generic mancozeb flowable. Multi-site contact fungicide, excellent tank-mix partner for resistance management. Similar to Fore.

mancozeb_dry.notes: Dry flowable formulation of mancozeb. Multi-site fungicide for resistance management tank-mixing.

myclobutanil.notes: Generic equivalent to Eagle. Systemic DMI triazole fungicide. Good summer patch and spring dead spot activity.

strobe_pro.notes: Premix of azoxystrobin + propiconazole. Two modes of action for broad-spectrum disease control and resistance management. Comparable to Headway.

enclave.notes: Four-way premix with four different FRAC groups. Excellent for resistance management. Broad-spectrum activity. Unique product in the turf market.

encartis.notes: Three-way premix with azoxystrobin + propiconazole + tebuconazole. Premium combination offering extended control windows.

prophesy.notes: Branded propiconazole product from Quali-Pro. Same active as their generic Propiconazole 14.3 ME.

torque.notes: Tebuconazole-based DMI fungicide. Strong fairy ring and spring dead spot activity. Higher loading triazole.

turfcide_400d.notes: PCNB fungicide primarily for snow mold control. Often tank-mixed with chlorothalonil for fall applications. Legacy turf product.

triticonazole.notes: Generic triticonazole. DMI triazole fungicide comparable to Trinity.

fluoxastrobin.notes: Generic fluoxastrobin. Strobilurin fungicide comparable to Disarm. Strong root disease activity.

fosetyl_al.notes: Generic equivalent to Signature/Chipco Signature. Phosphonate fungicide for Pythium and oomycete diseases. Systemic activity.

tebuconazole.notes: Generic tebuconazole flowable. Same AI as Torque but generic labeling.

fludioxonil.notes: Generic fludioxonil. Comparable to Medallion SC. Excellent snow mold and dollar spot activity.

quinclorac_75df.notes: Generic equivalent to Drive XLR8 (dry formulation). Post-emergence crabgrass and broadleaf weed control. Use with methylated seed oil.

quinclorac_1_5sl.notes: Liquid formulation of quinclorac. Generic equivalent to Drive XLR8 liquid.

prodiamine_4l.notes: Generic equivalent to Barricade. Industry-leading pre-emergence herbicide. Long residual activity. Yellow-staining potential.

prodiamine_65wdg.notes: Dry formulation of prodiamine. Generic Barricade 65WG. Easier to store and ship than liquid.

dithiopyr.notes: Generic equivalent to Dimension. Pre- and early post-emergence crabgrass control. Can be applied after crabgrass emergence (1-2 tiller).

sulfentrazone.notes: Generic equivalent to Dismiss. Excellent for sedge control. PPO inhibitor with rapid activity. Can cause temporary yellowing.

fahrenheit.notes: Two modes of action for broadleaf weed control. Dicamba + penoxsulam combination. Use on warm- and cool-season turf.

negate_37wg.notes: Dual-ALS inhibitor for warm-season turf only. Sedge and broadleaf control. Do not use on cool-season grasses. Comparable to Certainty + SedgeHammer combination.

msm_turf.notes: Metsulfuron-methyl sulfonylurea herbicide. Very low use rate. For cool-season turf and warm-season turf (excluding bahiagrass). Generic equivalent to Manor/Blade.

threesome.notes: Three-way broadleaf herbicide. 2,4-D + MCPP + dicamba combination. Generic equivalent to Trimec Classic. Industry standard broadleaf weed control.

2_4d_amine.notes: Standalone 2,4-D amine herbicide. Broadleaf weed control. Often used as a tank-mix component.

triclopyr_4ec.notes: Generic equivalent to Turflon Ester. Excellent for hard-to-control broadleaf weeds like wild violet and ground ivy. Safe on cool-season turf.

isoxaben_75wg.notes: Generic equivalent to Gallery. Pre-emergence broadleaf weed control. Does not control grassy weeds.

simazine_4l.notes: Pre-emergence herbicide for warm-season turf (bermudagrass, zoysiagrass, centipedegrass). Poa annua control.

pendimethalin_3_3ec.notes: Generic pendimethalin equivalent to Pendulum 3.3EC. Pre-emergence grassy and broadleaf weed control.

bifenthrin.notes: Generic equivalent to Talstar. Broad-spectrum pyrethroid for surface and subsurface insect control. Industry workhorse product.

bifenthrin_g.notes: Granular formulation of bifenthrin. Generic Talstar G equivalent. Broadcast application for subsurface pest control.

imidacloprid_2f.notes: Generic equivalent to Merit 2F. Preventive grub control. Apply before grub egg hatch (May-July). Systemic activity. Pollinator considerations apply.

imidacloprid_0_5g.notes: Granular formulation of imidacloprid. Generic Merit 0.5G equivalent. Preventive grub control in granular form.

lambda_cyhalothrin.notes: Generic equivalent to Scimitar GC. Capsule suspension pyrethroid for surface-feeding insect control.

chlorantraniliprole.notes: Generic equivalent to Acelepryn. Reduced-risk insecticide with low toxicity to pollinators. Longest grub control window. Premium generic option.

clothianidin.notes: Generic equivalent to Arena. Neonicotinoid insecticide for preventive grub and surface insect control.

trichlorfon.notes: Generic equivalent to Dylox. Curative grub control -- fast knockdown of active grubs. Short residual but fast acting.

carbaryl_4l.notes: Generic equivalent to Sevin SL. Broad-spectrum carbamate for surface-feeding insects. Earthworm toxic -- avoid overuse.

acephate_75sp.notes: Generic acephate. Systemic organophosphate with contact and systemic activity. Quick knockdown of surface feeders.

spinosad.notes: Naturally derived insecticide from Saccharopolyspora spinosa. Reduced-risk for turf caterpillar control. Generic Conserve equivalent.

rates.greens: 0.125-0.25 fl oz/1000 sq ft every 7-14 days
rates.fairways: 0.25-0.50 fl oz/1000 sq ft every 14-28 days
rates.roughs: 0.50-0.75 fl oz/1000 sq ft every 28 days

trinexapac_ethyl.notes: Generic equivalent to Primo MAXX. Industry-standard PGR for turf growth regulation. Use GDD model for reapplication timing.

paclobutrazol_2sc.frac_group: DMI (functions as PGR, not fungicide at PGR rates)
paclobutrazol_2sc.notes: Generic equivalent to Trimmit 2SC. Type II PGR -- root absorbed. Particularly effective on Poa annua suppression. Often used in combination with T-Nex.

flurprimidol_2sc.notes: Generic equivalent to Cutless. Type II PGR for Poa annua suppression. Often used in tank mix with trinexapac-ethyl.

ethephon_2sl.notes: Generic equivalent to Proxy. Ethylene-releasing PGR. Primarily used for Poa annua seedhead suppression. Often tank-mixed with trinexapac-ethyl for enhanced effect.

bifenthrin_imidacloprid.notes: Combination insecticide with two modes of action. Preventive + curative insect control in one application. Comparable to Allectus.
